Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot write network interface configuration.
ErrorDetails: Cannot write interface configuration on the device.

ErrorParams.interface: The network interface for which configuration cannot be written.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot read interface configuration.
ErrorDetails: Interface configuration is not readable.

ErrorParams.interface: The network interface for which configuration cannot be read.

Action: Specify a valid bundle specifier.
Cause: Invalid bundle specifier.
ErrorDetails: The specified bundle specifier is invalid.

Action: Verify that specified form values are correct.
Cause: One or more form fields in the user interface is blank or contains an invalid value.
ErrorDetails: All form fields in the user interface must have a valid value specified.
UserVisibleMessage: All form fields must have a valid value specified

Action: Verify that the GMI unit name is formatted correctly.
Cause: An incorrectly formatted GMI unit name is specified.
ErrorDetails: The GMI unit name format is invalid.

ErrorParams.unitName: The unit name to be validated.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: SA encountered an invalid object type.
ErrorDetails: SA encountered an object type inconsistent with the expected object type.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The local security policy failed to initialize for an unknown reason.
ErrorDetails: The local security policy failed to initialize for an unknown reason.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: A local security policy rule is invalid.
ErrorDetails: A local security policy contains an invalid rule.

ErrorParams.rule: The security policy rule which is invalid.

Action: Verify that the log file exists and has the correct permissions.
Cause: Cannot read or decipher the log file format.
ErrorDetails: The log file may be missing, have incorrect permissions or invalid format and cannot be read.
UserVisibleMessage: Missing, Unreadable, or Incorrectly Formatted Log File

Action: Verify that the specified file exists and that the SA Agent has Read permission.
Cause: The specified file's checksum failed.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent cannot read the specified file to perform a checksum operation.

ErrorParams.fileName: The filename of the file for which checksum is computed.

Action: Verify that the required python module is installed on the device.
Cause: A python module was not found and could not be loaded.
ErrorDetails: A required Python module was not found and therefore could not be loaded.

ErrorParams.module: A python module that could not be found.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot detect any network interfaces.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent cannot detect any network interfaces or read the network interface information for the device.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot find the matching role image package.
ErrorDetails: Cannot find the matching role image package for the disk and partition.
UserVisibleMessage: No Matching Role Image Package Found

Action: Obtain the necessary permissions to perform the current Code Deployment System action.
Cause: The user is not authorized to perform the current action.
ErrorDetails: The user does not have the required permissions to perform the current Code Deployment System action.
UserVisibleMessage: You are not authorized to perform this action

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: A problem occurred while activating a package.
ErrorDetails: A problem occurred while activating a package. On the Solaris and Linux platforms, packages are activated using a depot script on the device.

Action: Verify that the package(s) exist in the Package Repository and ensure that there is network connectivity to the Package Repository.
Cause: Package(s) could not be downloaded.
ErrorDetails: The package(s) could not be downloaded from the Package Repository due to missing package(s) or network connectivity issues.

Action: Verify that the package is a supported package type. Verify that the latest version of the SA Agent library is installed on the device.
Cause: Could not find any available package handlers.
ErrorDetails: Could not find any available package handlers. Either the package type was invalid or the SA Agent library (coglib) is missing on the device.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot list all installed software packages.
ErrorDetails: Cannot list all software packages installed on the device. An SA Agent library (coglib) issue is probably causing the list generation to fail.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Unable to change user password.
ErrorDetails: Unable to change a user password to access SA Agent UI.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The local PCI database cannot be read and examined correctly.
ErrorDetails: The local PCI database could not be read and examined correctly; therefore, the SA Agent was unable to read device information from the local system.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The specified process could not be forcibly terminated.
ErrorDetails: The process with the specified ID could not be forcibly terminated using the SA Agent UI.

ErrorParams.processID: The process id of the process to be terminated.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot restart device.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent cannot restart the device.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Reconciliation of installed software packages failed.
ErrorDetails: The reconciliation of installed software packages failed. See the additional displayed error message.

ErrorParams.message: The message stating why the reconcile could not complete.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The SA Agent cannot find a remote Command Engine.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent cannot communicate with a remote Command Engine.

Action: Verify that the required form values are specified.
Cause: A form field required to process the request is blank.
ErrorDetails: A form field in SA Agent UI is blank and requires a value to process the request.
UserVisibleMessage: All Form Fields Must Have a Valid Value Specified

Action: Verify that the remote procedure call is correct. If the problem persists, contact technical support.
Cause: A remote procedure call failed.
ErrorDetails: A remote procedure call (RPC) to the SA Agent from the Package Repository or Command Engine failed. A script is failing or the components are calling an invalid method.

Action: Verify that a software package name is specified in the RPC. If the problem persists, contact technical support.
Cause: A required software package name is missing in the RPC.
ErrorDetails: A software package name is missing and is a required parameter in the remote procedure call (RPC).
UserVisibleMessage: A Software Package Name Missing from the Remote Procedure Call

Action: Verify that the required RPC parameters are specified. If the problem persists, contact technical support.
Cause: A required parameter was not specified in an RPC.
ErrorDetails: A required parameter was specified in a remote procedure call (RPC).

ErrorParams.argument: The required argument not passed to the remote procedure call.

UserVisibleMessage: Required Remote Procedure Call Parameter Missing

Action: Specify a correct RPC class object. If the problem persists, contact technical support.
Cause: Unknown RPC class object.
ErrorDetails: Unknown Remote Procedure Call (RPC) class object.
UserVisibleMessage: Remote Procedure Call Failed: Unknown Class Object

Action: Verify the remote procedure called. If the problem persists, contact technical support.
Cause: Unknown remote procedure called.
ErrorDetails: An unknown or invalid remote procedure was called.

Action: Retry the action on the service. If the problem persists, contact technical support.
Cause: An action failed to be performed on a service.
ErrorDetails: The action specified failed to be performed on the service.

ErrorParams.action: The action being taken on the service.

Action: Check the file containing the service configuration for problems.
Cause: Cannot commit the service configuration.
ErrorDetails: Cannot commit the service configuration. The SA Agent tried to read or write the service configuration but failed. On the Windows platform, the configuration is stored in the Registry. On the Linux and Solaris platforms, the configuration is stored in system files.

ErrorParams.service: The service whose configuration is to be committed.

Action: Check the file containing the service configuration for problems.
Cause: Cannot read the service configuration.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent cannot read the service configuration. On the Windows platform, the configuration is stored in the Registry. On the Linux and Solaris platforms, the configuration is stored in system files.

ErrorParams.service: The service whose configuration is to be read.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot list all services for the device.
ErrorDetails: Cannot list all services for the device.

Action: Attempt to start the service again. If the problem persists, contact technical support.
Cause: Service cannot be started.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent cannot start the specified service. The service currently has the displayed status.

ErrorParams.service: The name of the service being started.
ErrorParams.status: The current status of the specified service.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot shut down device.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent cannot shut down a device.

Action: Verify network connectivity between the device and the listener on the specified port.
Cause: A socket connection cannot be made.
ErrorDetails: A socket connection cannot be made to the device and port specified.

ErrorParams.host: The name of the host that is attempting to be connected.
ErrorParams.port: The number of the port that is attempting to be connected on the host.

Action: Verify that the appropriate image exists in the Package Repository and that the SA Agent on the device has network connectivity to the Package Repository.
Cause: Cannot download the image.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent cannot download the image to the device.

Action: Verify the permissions for the directory and its included files. If the permissions set for the directory allow file removal, contact technical support.
Cause: The temporary files in a directory could not be removed.
ErrorDetails: The files in a directory used for temporary storage could not be removed.

ErrorParams.directory: The directory of temporary files to be cleaned.

UserVisibleMessage: Temporary Files in Directory Not Removed

Action: Verify that only a single role is associated with the device.
Cause: There are too many device roles associated with the device.
ErrorDetails: There are too many device roles associated with the device with the machine ID specified.

ErrorParams.machineID: The id of the local machine.

UserVisibleMessage: Device Has Too Many Associated Roles

Action: Ensure that the latest version of the SA Agent library is installed on the device, then restart the SA Agent.
Cause: Cannot list all of the installed packages.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent cannot list all of the installed packages on the device. The SA Agent library (coglib) may be missing on the device.

Action: Contact technical support to verify that the command type issued is valid.
Cause: An Unknown command type was issued.
ErrorDetails: The Command Engine called the SA Agent using an unknown type of command.

ErrorParams.type: The type of the command being executed.

Action: Verify that the device is associated with a customer.
Cause: Unable to determine the customer associated with the local device.
ErrorDetails: Unable to determine the customer associated with the local device with the specified machine ID.

ErrorParams.machineID: The id of the machine of unknown customer.

Action: Verify that the local facility has a valid record in the Model Repository (truth). If the facility has a valid record, contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot find entries in the Model Repository (truth) for the local facility.
ErrorDetails: The local facility may not be registered with the Model Repository (truth).

Action: Verify that the Model Repository (truth) contains a device record with the associated machine ID.
Cause: Unable to find device information in the Model Repository (truth).
ErrorDetails: Unable to find device information in the Model Repository (truth) for the specified machine ID.

ErrorParams.machineID: The id of the machine without a device record.

Action: Verify that a device role exists for the specified device or device role ID.
Cause: Cannot find device role.
ErrorDetails: Cannot find a device role for the device with the specified machine ID, device ID, or device role ID.

ErrorParams.deviceID: The device id of the local device.
ErrorParams.deviceRoleID: The device role id that does not exist.
ErrorParams.machineID: The machine id of the local device.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: An unknown problem occurred.
ErrorDetails: An unknown problem occurred and generated the displayed message.

ErrorParams.message: Message explaining the error that occurred.

Action: Verify that a record for the host name exists in DNS.
Cause: Unable to resolve host name in DNS.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent is unable to resolve the host name in DNS.

ErrorParams.hostName: The name of the host that cannot be resolved.

UserVisibleMessage: Host Name Does Not Resolve in DNS

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Unable to determine the ID of the local device.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent is unable to determine the ID of the local device.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Unable to determine the local device's operating system.
ErrorDetails: Unable to determine the operating system of the local device with the specified machine ID.

ErrorParams.machineID: The id of the machine with an unknown operating system.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The SA Agent was unable to determine the process ID of its process group leader.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent was unable to determine the process ID of its process group leader.

Action: Ensure that the SA Agent(coglib) and python libraries are installed on the device, then restart the SA Agent.
Cause: Unable to determine process information.
ErrorDetails: Unable to determine process information for the process ID specified. The error may occur due to problems with a library.

Action: Verify that the device has a role of the correct type in the Model Repository (truth). If the device already has a role of the correct type, contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot find the role for the local device in the Model Repository (truth).
ErrorDetails: Cannot find a role in the Model Repository (truth) of the type specified for the local device.

ErrorParams.name: The name of the role of the device.
ErrorParams.type: The type of the role of the device.
ErrorParams.version: The version of the role of the device.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot determine the role image unit disk information.
ErrorDetails: Cannot determine the role image unit disk information.
UserVisibleMessage: Cannot Determine Role Image Unit Disk Information

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot determine the role image unit information.
ErrorDetails: Cannot determine the role image unit information for the specified server initialization ID, application role ID, or account role ID.

ErrorParams.accountRoleID: The account role id of the device.
ErrorParams.applicationRoleID: The application role id of the device.
ErrorParams.embryoID: The embryo id of the device.

UserVisibleMessage: Cannot Determine Role Image Unit Information

Action: Verify that the device has a role of the correct type in the Model Repository (truth). If the device already has a role of the correct type, contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot find information in the Model Repository (truth) about a role for the local device.
ErrorDetails: Cannot find information in the Truth about a role of the type specified for the local device.

Action: Specify a valid action (start, stop, reload, restart) on the service.
Cause: Unsupported action cannot be performed on a service.
ErrorDetails: The action specified is unsupported and cannot be performed on the service.

ErrorParams.action: The action being taken on the service.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: An unknown error occurred when the SA Agent communicated with the Model Repository (truth).
ErrorDetails: An unknown error occurred when the SA Agent communicated with the Model Repository (truth). See the displayed message for more information.

ErrorParams.message: The message explaining the error talking to the truth.

Action: Verify that the package has a valid record in the Model Repository (truth). If the package already has a valid record, contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot find information in the Model Repository (truth) about a package.
ErrorDetails: Cannot find information in the Model Repository (truth) about the package with the specified ID.

ErrorParams.unitID: The id of the unknown package.

Action: Ensure that the local device has a supported operating system installed. If the device already has a supported operating system installed, contact technical support.
Cause: The local device's installed operating system is not supported.
ErrorDetails: The operating system installed on the local device is not supported.
UserVisibleMessage: Local Device has an Unsupported Operating System Installed

Action: Ensure that the service to be accessed is a valid service on the local device.
Cause: The service does not exist on the local system.
ErrorDetails: The specified service does not exist on the local system.

ErrorParams.service: The service trying to be acted upon.

Action: Ensure that the device has the correct roles.
Cause: Unable to retrieve Agent configuration information.
ErrorDetails: The current device is attached to incorrect roles. Unable to retrieve the SA Agent configuration information.

Action: Ensure that the latest version of the SA Agent library (coglib) is installed on the device then restart the SA Agent.
Cause: Cannot list local users.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent cannot list local users. An SA Agent library (coglib) issue may be causing list generation to fail.

Action: Contact technical support
Cause: Unable to read process ID from the PID file.
ErrorDetails: Unable to read process ID information from the specified file.

ErrorParams.pidfile: Name of process ID file that was being read when the error occurred

UserVisibleMessage: Process ID Could Not be Read in the PID File

Action: Verify that the package was successfully downloaded from the Package Repository.
Cause: Cannot activate the package.
ErrorDetails: Cannot activate the package.

Action: Verify that the Package Repository is functioning by running the SA System Diagnosis tools. Ensure that the SA Agent is configured to connect to the correct TCP port.
Cause: The SA Agent failed to connect to the cleartext (unencrypted) Package Repository during the health check.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent failed to connect to the cleartext (unencrypted) Package Repository during the health check.
UserVisibleMessage: Health Check: Package Repository Connection Failed

Action: Ensure that the SA Agent and Data Access Engine are functioning by running the SA Admin System Diagnosis tools, then restart the SA Agent. If the problem persists, contact technical support.
Cause: The SA Agent was unable to register the device software with the Data Access Engine.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent was unable to register the device software with the Data Access Engine.

ErrorParams.error: The error message explaining why the software could not be registered.

Action: Verify that the specified package is a valid package type.
Cause: Unknown package type.
ErrorDetails: Unknown package type.

ErrorParams.type: The type of the package that is unknown.

Action: Ensure that the remote Command Engine (way) is permitted to command the local cogbot component or that the local cogbot has been commanded by the local Way to trust the remote Way.
Cause: An error occurred using or changing a remote Command Engine (way)
ErrorDetails: An error occurred using or changing a remote Command Engine (way)
UserVisibleMessage: Error using a remote Command Engine (way)

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The called method is not supported for the current operating system.
ErrorDetails: The called method is not supported for the current operating system. Some wrappers are not symmetric.

ErrorParams.method: Abstract method that was not implemented in concrete class.

UserVisibleMessage: Method Not Supported for the Current Operating System

Action: Ensure that the package is correctly defined and applicable to the selected server. If the problem persists, please contact technical support.
Cause: An error occurred while installing or removing this package.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred while installing or removing this package. The package may not be applicable to the selected server.

ErrorParams.command: Command used to install or remove package.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: An error occurred in a Package Handler.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred in a Package Handler.
UserVisibleMessage: An error occurred in a Package Handler.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: No Package Handler was found for this package.
ErrorDetails: No Package Handler was found for this package.

Action: Please correct the options for this package.  If the problem persists, please contact technical support.
Cause: The install or remove flags associated with this package are invalid.
ErrorDetails: The options associated with this package are invalid.

Action: Verify that the package and package type are valid and/or compatible.  If the problem persists, please contact technical support.
Cause: The file specified for uploading is not in the correct format for the specified package type.
ErrorDetails: The package is not in the correct format for the specified package type.

Action: Install the required package technology for the specified package type.
Cause: The package technology required to install the specified package is not installed on this device.
ErrorDetails: The package technology required to install the specified package is not installed on this device.

ErrorParams.name: Name of the package technology. For example 'RPM'.

Action: Free up more space on the Server or specify additional download paths under the key '$package_download_dir' in the server's Customer Attributes.
Cause: There is insufficient free space on this server to complete the necessary package downloads using any of the specified paths.
ErrorDetails: There is insufficient free space on this server to complete the necessary package downloads using any of the specified paths.

ErrorParams.paths: Paths that were tried when the agent attempted to find a location with sufficient space.
ErrorParams.space_needed: Disk space needed to complete the package download.

UserVisibleMessage: Insufficient Disk Space for Requested Package Download(s)

Action: Ensure that the device's network configuration is valid.
Cause: An internal error occurred while processing the device's network configuration.
ErrorDetails: An internal error occurred while processing the device's network configuration: the network configuration to be applied to the device is invalid.

ErrorParams.message: Detailed information about the invalid network configuration item(s).

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot write network configuration information.
ErrorDetails: Unable to commit the network configuration information for this server.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The SA agent was unable to connect to a server.
ErrorDetails: The SA agent was unable to connect to the specified server.
UserVisibleMessage: Error Connecting to the Specified Server

Action: Ensure that the certificate presented by the begin command (poke) specifies: issuer "SA" and subject "waybot".
Cause: The SA Agent received a begin command (poke) message from a client which presented an incorrect SSL certificate.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent received a begin command (poke) message from a client which presented an incorrect SSL certificate.

ErrorParams.address: The IP address of the client which presented the incorrect certificate.
ErrorParams.issuer: The name of the certificate authority which issued the certificate.
ErrorParams.subject: The name of the certificate

Action: Ensure that the details of the operation to be performed are appropriate for the managed server on which the operation will occur.
Cause: An exception was raised on the managed server from the SA Global Shell's file handler.
ErrorDetails: An exception was raised on the managed server from the SA Global Shell's file handler.

ErrorParams.args: The details of the platform-specific exception raised
ErrorParams.exception: The name of the platform-specific exception raised

UserVisibleMessage: SA Global Shell File Handler Exception

Action: Ensure that the correct authentication credentials are provided
Cause: The credentials provided for this operation do not match.
ErrorDetails: The credentials provided for this operation do not match.

ErrorParams.username: The username component of the credentials

Action: Ensure that a valid Username is specified.
Cause: No username was supplied with this operation request.
ErrorDetails: No username was supplied with this operation request.

Action: Ensure that the parameters of the XML-RPC call are in the Agent's cogbot.log file.
Cause: No script name was provided in the OGSH XML-RPC call.
ErrorDetails: No script name was provided in the OGSH XML-RPC call.
UserVisibleMessage: No Script Name Provided in the OGSH XML-RPC Call

Action: Verify that all connections are still current and drop any unneeded connections.
Cause: The Maximum number of allowed concurrent Shell connections to the SA Agent has been reached
ErrorDetails: The Maximum number of allowed concurrent Shell connections to the SA Agent has been reached
UserVisibleMessage: Maximum Number of Concurrent Shell Connections Reached

ErrorDetails: Unable to list the content of deb package: {0}.
Cause: Most likely cause of this error is that the current version of the tar utility running on the core server does not support the format of the data.tar file inside the DEB package.
Action: Upgrade the tar utility on the core servers.
Contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot download a backup version from the Package Repository.
ErrorDetails: Cannot download the specified backup version from the Package Repository.

ErrorParams.message: Message explaining why an error occurred.
ErrorParams.version: The version of the backup being downloaded.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Unable to parse the item map for the version.
ErrorDetails: Unable to parse the item map for the version specified. See the displayed message.

ErrorParams.message: Message explaining why an error occurred.
ErrorParams.version: The version of the backup being parsed.

UserVisibleMessage: Item Map for Version Not Parsed

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The Configbot engine failed to run.
ErrorDetails: The Configbot engine failed to run in the mode specified.

ErrorParams.mode: The backup mode in which configbot should run.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: An internal error occurred in the Configstore.
ErrorDetails: An internal error occurred in the Configstore. See the displayed message.

Action: Verify that the file being referenced is a Configbot log file.
Cause: The file is not a Configbot log file.
ErrorDetails: The specified file is not a valid Configbot log file.

ErrorParams.fileName: The name of the file that is not a configbot log file.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The Configbot is not installed or is currently disabled within the SA Agent.
ErrorDetails: The Configbot is not installed or is currently disabled within the SA Agent.

Action: Ensure that the action request to the Configbot is valid.
Cause: The Configbot attempted to run an unknown action.
ErrorDetails: The Configbot attempted to run the unknown action specified.

ErrorParams.action: The action which configbot cannot execute.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: An unknown error occurred in the Configbot.
ErrorDetails: An unknown error occurred in the Configbot. See the displayed message.

ErrorParams.message: Message explaining why the error occurred.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Unable to update the enabled state of the Configbot.
ErrorDetails: Unable to update the enabled state of the Configbot.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Unable to update configuration WADs.
ErrorDetails: Unable to update configuration WADs.

Action: Verify that the referenced file is a Logbot log file.
Cause: The file is not a Logbot log file.
ErrorDetails: The file specified is not a Logbot log file.

ErrorParams.fileName: The name of the file that is not a logbot log file.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The Logbot is not installed or is disabled within the SA Agent.
ErrorDetails: The Logbot is not installed or is disabled within the SA Agent.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot rotate log files.
ErrorDetails: The Logbot cannot rotate the log files for the specified set.

ErrorParams.set: Logical grouping of log files for rotation.

Action: Restart the SA Agent or remove the device group from the nested group.
Cause: The device is not a member of the logging group or the device belongs to a nested group (a group within a group).
ErrorDetails: The device is not a member of the logging group or the device belongs to a nested group (a group within a group).

Action: Verify that a valid pfbot action is requested.
Cause: The pfbot attempted to run an invalid action.
ErrorDetails: The pfbot attempted to run the specified action but the action is invalid.

ErrorParams.action: The action which pfbot cannot execute.

Action: Install or restart the pfbot.
Cause: The pfbot is either not installed or not running
ErrorDetails: The pfbot is either not installed or not running

Action: Ensure that you can ping the host and that the host is functioning using the SA Admin System Diagnosis tools. Verify that the presentation server is responding.
Cause: The presentation server failed to run a diagnostic test.
ErrorDetails: The presentation server tried to run an XMLRPC method on the device but received the displayed response.

ErrorParams.host: The host the server was trying to call the method on.
ErrorParams.method: The method the server was trying to call.
ErrorParams.response: The response or error that was raised.

Action: Verify that the device specified is attached to only one Role at or beneath the Role Type specified.
Cause: The device configuration cannot be determined due to an ambiguous Role attachment.
ErrorDetails: The device configuration cannot be determined because the device is improperly attached to descendant(s) of the specified Role Type.

ErrorParams.childRCIDs: The ID(s) of the Roles to which the Device is attached beneath the parent Role.
ErrorParams.deviceID: The ID of the ambiguously attached Device.
ErrorParams.parentRCID: The ID of the Role where the ambiguity was detected.

UserVisibleMessage: Device Configuration Cannot be Determined: Ambiguous Role Attachment

Action: Break the circular role dependency by deleting one of the conflicting dependencies.
Cause: A circular Role dependency was detected.
ErrorDetails: The specified Roles are incorrectly dependent on each other and cause a circular dependency.

ErrorParams.conflictingRCID: The Role where the cycle was detected.
ErrorParams.sourceRCID: The starting point of the dependency chain which contains the conflict.

Action: Ensure that the file being referenced is an Accountbot log file.
Cause: The file is not an Accountbot log file.
ErrorDetails: The file is not an Accountbot log file.

ErrorParams.fileName: The name of the file that is not an accountbot log file.

UserVisibleMessage: Specified File is Not a Valid Accountbot Log File

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The Accountbot is not installed or is disabled within the SA Agent.
ErrorDetails: The Accountbot is not installed or is disabled within the SA Agent.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot determine the required parameters to run the command.
ErrorDetails: Cannot determine the required parameters to run the command under the installed operating system.

ErrorParams.platform: The platform on which the command is to be executed.

UserVisibleMessage: Required Command Parameters Cannot Be Determined

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The specified command did not run correctly.
ErrorDetails: The specified command did not run correctly.

Action: Ensure that the data that you enter in the SA Agent UI is consistent with the data in the Model Repository (truth).
Cause: Values from different sources for the same object are not consistent.
ErrorDetails: Values entered in the SA Agent are not consistent with the data in the Model Repository (truth).

ErrorParams.item1: The first item being compared for consistency.
ErrorParams.item2: The second item being compared for consistency.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot erase the manifest for CDS operation.
ErrorDetails: The synclet could not erase a manifest when performing a Code Deployment System (CDS) operation. CDS creates a manifest of updated files between staging and production host directories.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The synclet cannot load the CDS manifest.
ErrorDetails: The synclet could not load a CDS manifest when performing a Code Deployment System operation. CDS creates a manifest of updated files between staging and production host directories.

Action: Ensure that the crontab directory exists or that it has not been moved.
Cause: Unable to find the crontab directory.
ErrorDetails: Unable to find the crontab directory. The location of the directory varies by platform. On Solaris, the directory path is /var/spool/cron/crontabs. On Linux, the directory path is var/spool/cron.
UserVisibleMessage: Unable to Find the crontab Directory

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot determine the partition layout of a fixed disk on the local device.
ErrorDetails: Cannot determine the partition layout of a fixed disk on the local device.

Action: Verify that the doohickey is attached to the device.
Cause: Unable to read doohickey information from the device.
ErrorDetails: Unable to read doohickey information from the device.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: A duplicate role image package was found.
ErrorDetails: A duplicate role image package was found for the target disk and partition.

ErrorParams.disk: The target fixed disk of the operation.
ErrorParams.partition: The target disk partition of the operation.

Action: Verify that the file exists and has the correct permissions.
Cause: Cannot find the file.
ErrorDetails: Cannot find the specified file.

Action: Ensure that the file exists and has the correct permissions.
Cause: Cannot open a file.
ErrorDetails: Cannot open the specified file.

ErrorParams.fileName: The name of the file that could not be opened.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Unable to detect the hardware for this device.
ErrorDetails: Unable to detect the hardware for this device.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Unable to register the device hardware with the Data Access Engine.
ErrorDetails: Unable to register the device hardware with the Data Access Engine.

ErrorParams.error: The error message explaining why the hardware could not be registered.

Action: Verify that firewall conduits exist to the Data Access Engine. Verify that the Data Access Engine is functioning by running the SA Admin System Diagnosis tools.
Cause: Failed to connect to the Data Access Engine.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent failed to connect to the Data Access Engine during the health check.
UserVisibleMessage: Health Check: Data Access Engine Connection Failed

Action: Verify that firewall conduits exist to the Command Engine. Verify that the Command Engine is functioning by running the SA Admin System Diagnosis tools.
Cause: Failed to connect to the Command Engine.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent failed to connect to the Command Engine during the health check.
UserVisibleMessage: Health Check: Command Engine Connection Failed

Action: Verify that firewall conduits exist to the Package Repository. Verify that the Package Repository is functioning by running the SA Admin System Diagnosis tools.
Cause: Failed to connect to the Package Repository.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent failed to connect to the Package Repository during the health check.
UserVisibleMessage: Health Check: Package Repository Connection Failed

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The depot installed on the device contained errors.
ErrorDetails: The depot on the device has been corrupted. Each device managed by SA has a depot (script) that controls software package installation.

Action: Check the connection to the Data Access Engine from the SA Agent. Check that the device is generating a hardware list. Verify that the SA Agent installed on the device is the latest version. Restart the SA Agent.
Cause: Failed to register hardware with the Model Repository (truth).
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent failed to register the device with the Data Access Engine during a health check.

Action: Verify that the Command Engine and SA Agent are functioning by running the SA Admin System Diagnosis tools. If necessary, restart the core components.
Cause: Failed to register the SA Agent with the Command Engine.
ErrorDetails: SA failed to register the SA Agent with the Command Engine.
UserVisibleMessage: Health Check: Command Engine Registration Failed

Action: Verify that the SA Agent installed on the device is the latest version then restart the SA Agent.
Cause: Failed to generate the hardware list.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent failed to generate the hardware list and machine IDs for the device.
UserVisibleMessage: Health Check: Hardware List Generation Failed

Action: Check the release level of the installed packages. Verify that the latest release of the SA Agent is installed on the device. Restart the SA Agent.
Cause: Getting the installed package list failed.
ErrorDetails: Retrieving the installed packages list for the device failed.
UserVisibleMessage: Health Check: Get Installed Packages List Failed

Action: The hive.starttime may have been corrupted. Restart the SA Agent.
Cause: The SA Agent uptime calculation failed.
ErrorDetails: Calculating the SA Agent uptime failed.
UserVisibleMessage: Health Check: SA Agent Uptime Calculation Failed

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The single-threaded apartment for the device is not running.
ErrorDetails: The single-threaded apartment for the device is not running.
UserVisibleMessage: Device Single Threaded Apartment Not Running

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Cannot detect information from the local device.
ErrorDetails: Cannot detect information of the type specified from the local device.

ErrorParams.type: The type of the information that cannot be detected.

Action: Free some disk space on device.
Cause: Insufficient disk space on device.
ErrorDetails: Unable to install the package because of insufficient disk space.

ErrorParams.command: Command used to install or remove package.

Action: Contact technical support to remove or rename one of the conflicting parameters.
Cause: A configuration parameter name conflict has been detected.
ErrorDetails: SA has detected a conflict with the configuration parameter name. The configuration of a component is defined at multiple points in the role hierarchy. Therefore, it is not possible to determine which configuration parameter to use.

ErrorParams.conflictingRCID: The ID of the Role which specifies the conflicting parameter.
ErrorParams.parameterName: The name of the conflicting parameter
ErrorParams.roleClassID: The ID of the Role where the conflict was detected.

Action: Verify that the Model Repository (truth) database is functioning by running the SA Admin System Diagnosis tools. Verify that network connectivity exists to the Truth database.
Cause: A problem was encountered connecting to the Model Repository (truth) database.
ErrorDetails: A problem was encountered connecting to the Model Repository (truth) database. The application returned the displayed message.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: A database constraint was violated.
ErrorDetails: A database constraint was violated. The application returned the displayed message.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: A Data Access Engine error that does not fall into a known category occurred.
ErrorDetails: An unknown Data Access Engine error occurred. The application returned the displayed message.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: An unclassified error involving the Model Repository (truth) database occurred.
ErrorDetails: An unclassified error involving the Model Repository (truth) database occurred. The application returned the displayed message.

Action: Verify that the parameter name exists in the configuration specification inherited by the specified Role, and that the parameter has a specified value.
Cause: The specified parameter name is not valid for the Role.
ErrorDetails: The specified parameter name is not valid for the Role. If this error occurred while retrieving a configuration value, an invalid value for the Role was specified. If this error occurred while setting a value, the parameter name is not defined in the context of the Role.

ErrorParams.paramName: The parameter name specified in the operation
ErrorParams.roleClassID: The ID of the Role from which the operation was attempted.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The Data Access Engine is locked.
ErrorDetails: The Data Access Engine is locked. The application returned the displayed message.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Expected data was not found in the Model Repository (truth) database.
ErrorDetails: Expected data was not found in the Model Repository (truth) database. The application returned the displayed message.
UserVisibleMessage: Data Not Found in Model Repository (truth) Database

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Expected data was not unique in the Model Repository (truth) database.
ErrorDetails: Expected data was not unique in the Model Repository (truth) database. The application returned the displayed message.
UserVisibleMessage: Duplicate Data Found in Model Repository (truth) Database

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Permissions not sufficient to run this method.
ErrorDetails: Permissions not sufficient to run this method. The application returned the displayed message.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: A problem was encountered connecting to another Data Access Engine.
ErrorDetails: A problem was encountered connecting to another Data Access Engine. The application returned the displayed message.
UserVisibleMessage: Connection to Data Access Engine Failed

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: A Data Access Engine method was called incorrectly.
ErrorDetails: A Data Access Engine method was called incorrectly. The application returned the displayed message.

Action: Apply a different template to the device or modify the customer and/or operating system associations of the device or template.
Cause: The customer account or operating system associations of the device are not in the set of customer accounts or operating systems associated with the template.
ErrorDetails: Cannot apply the template to the device because the customer account or operating system of the device are not in the set of customer accounts or operating systems associated with the template.

ErrorParams.device_owner: The account or platform associated with the device.
ErrorParams.template_owners: The accounts or platforms associated with the template.

Action: Resolve the transaction conflicts by running the SA Administration Multimaster tools.
Cause: The Data Access Engine's Multimaster databases are out of synchronization.
ErrorDetails: The Data Access Engine's Multimaster databases are out of synchronization. The application returned the displayed message.

Action: Verify that you are attaching the device to the intended Role.
Cause: The Role specified is already attached to the device.
ErrorDetails: The Role specified is already attached to the device.

ErrorParams.dvcid: ID of the Device you're attaching to
ErrorParams.roleid: ID of the Role you're attaching to

Action: Resolve the transaction conflict by running the SA Administration Multimaster Tools.
Cause: Objects involved in the request are locked due to a Multimaster database conflict.
ErrorDetails: The objects involved in the request are locked due to a Multimaster database conflict. The application returned the displayed message.

Action: Verify that the device has unique crypto material on record. If required, overwrite the existing crypto material by running the recertification Command Engine script (??Core Recertification??).
Cause: The Data Access Engine will not generate new crypto material for this device. The device has valid crypto material which cannot be overridden.
ErrorDetails: The Data Access Engine will not generate new crypto material for this device. The device has valid crypto material which cannot be overridden.

ErrorParams.deviceid: The device id of the managed server for which new crypto material is being generated

Action: Specify a value for the configuration parameter and restart the Data Access Engine.
Cause: The Data Access Engine is missing a configuration parameter.
ErrorDetails: The Data Access Engine does not have a value for the configuration parameter and no default value applies.

ErrorParams.config_param: The parameter whose value is missing

UserVisibleMessage: Missing Data Access Engine Configuration Parameter

Action: Generate a new certificate for the server and deploy it to the server. See the SA Administration Guide for more information.
Cause: The SA Agent is not authorized to connect to Data Access Engine with the current certificate.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent on the managed server is not authorized to connect to the Data Access Engine with the certificate presented.

ErrorParams.peer_cert_subj_cn: The subject common name (CN) field of the certificate presented by the managed server.
ErrorParams.ipaddr: The IP address of the managed server presenting the certificate.

Action: Verify that the device is authorized by an SA user to be registered with the certificate presented
Cause: The SA Agent is not authorized by an SA user to be registered to Data Access Engine with the current certificate.
ErrorDetails: The SA Agent on the server is not authorized by an SA user to be registered to the Data Access Engine with the certificate presented.

ErrorParams.status: The registration status of the device.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: A database foreign key constraint was violated.
ErrorDetails: A database foreign key constraint was violated.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: A database not null constraint was violated.
ErrorDetails: A database not null constraint was violated.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: A database unique constraint was violated.
ErrorDetails: A database unique constraint was violated.

Action: Verify that the device is allowed to obtain new crypto material and that new crypto material exists in the crypto cache/pool on the Data Access Engine host.
Cause: The Data Access Engine will not return new crypto material for this device.
ErrorDetails: A failure has occurred during retrieval of new crypto material for this device

ErrorParams.deviceid: The device for which new crypto material is being retrieved.

Action: Contact technical support and provide the SA component's log file.
Cause: Cannot obtain the private key for the Package Repository.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred while retrieving the private key of the Package Repository. The private key is required to sign packages and verify the signatures before files are served.
UserVisibleMessage: Error Obtaining Package Repository Private Key

Action: Contact technical support and provide the filename and path.
Cause: Failed to verify the signature for the requested file because the signature is missing.
ErrorDetails: Failed to verify the signature for the requested file because the signature is missing.

Action: Contact technical support and provide the filename and path.
Cause: Failed to verify the signature for the requested file.
ErrorDetails: Failed to verify the signature for the requested file. The Package Repository cannot serve the file.

Action: Verify that the Data Access Engine is running and accepting connections on the specified port by running the SA Administration System Diagnosis tools.
Cause: Cannot establish a connection from the Package Repository to the Data Access Engine.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred establishing a connection from the Package Repository to the Data Access Engine.

ErrorParams.traceback: Internal python traceback from the exception (for debugging purposes)

UserVisibleMessage: Connection Error to Data Access Engine

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: An error has occurred during file transfer.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred during file upload, download, or cache methods. This error only occurs when SA is running in Multimaster mode.

Action: Contact technical support and provide the SA component's log file.
Cause: Cannot upload the file.
ErrorDetails: The file was not uploaded because an error occurred while registering the file with the Model Repository (truth).

Action: Contact technical support and provide the SA component's log file.
Cause: Error creating XML list of the directory.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred while creating an XML list of the directory.

Action: Verify that the package unit exists in the Model Repository (truth).
Cause: Error retrieving unit from the Model Repository (truth)
ErrorDetails: An error occurred retrieving the package unit information from the Model Repository (truth).

ErrorParams.unit_loc: Path to the package location on the Word.

UserVisibleMessage: Package Information Missing from Model Repository (truth)

Action: Contact technical support and provide the SA component's log file.
Cause: Error occurred while obtaining a global listing.
ErrorDetails: Error obtaining the global listing. This error only occurs when using the Wordclient UI and when SA is running in Multimaster mode.

Action: Log into the Wordclient UI and check the contents of the directory to ensure that it does not contain a broken symlink. If the problem persists, contact technical support and provide the SA component's log file.
Cause: Error occurred producing directory listing.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred while producing the directory listing. This error only occurs when using the Wordclient UI.

ErrorParams.path: Path for which listing should be generated

Action: Packages (RPMs, ZIPs, etc.) cannot belong to the operating system "OS Independent". Specify a different operating system for the package and upload it again.
Cause: A package with the operating system specified as "OS Independent" could not be uploaded.
ErrorDetails: A package with the operating system specified as "OS Independent" could not be uploaded to the Package Repository.
UserVisibleMessage: Package cannot have the Operating System Specified as "OS Independent"

Action: Contact your SA Administrator to verify the operating systems specified as valid for packages in SA.
Cause: The operating system could not be located in the Model Repository (truth) using the specified short name and version.
ErrorDetails: The operating system could not be located in the Model Repository (truth) using the specified short name and version.

ErrorParams.platform_short_name: The short name of the platform.

UserVisibleMessage: Operating System Short Name and Version Not Valid in Model Repository (truth)

Action: Upload a valid package type to the Package Repository. See the SA Software Management documentation for a list of supported package types.
Cause: The package type specified is not valid.
ErrorDetails: The package type specified is not valid.
UserVisibleMessage: Package Type Not Defined in the Model Repository (truth)

Action: This error only applies to Multimaster configurations. To obtain the package contents: 1. Log into the Wordclient UI. 2. View the global listing. 3. Select the directory where the file exists and follow the 'info' link.
Cause: The file does not exist at the specified location.
ErrorDetails: Multimaster does not support "fileinfo" (get package contents) calls. The Package Repository cannot get package contents from a package that is not found on its local file system.
UserVisibleMessage: Package Not Found in Local Package Repository

Action: Convert the file to a supported type and re-upload it.
Cause: The file type of the package is not supported.
ErrorDetails: The file type of the package is not supported.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: SA encountered an error while attempting to process an uploaded package.
ErrorDetails: SA encountered an error while attempting to process an uploaded package.

Action: Ensure that the .ACL file exists in /var/opt/opsware/crypto/wordbot, is readable and contains valid python expressions.
Cause: Error evaluating authorization policy.
ErrorDetails: Error evaluating authorization policy.

Action: Contact SA Technical Support and provide the name of the configuration parameter
Cause: An error prevented updating the Patch Management configuration.
ErrorDetails: An error prevented updating the Patch Management configuration.
UserVisibleMessage: Failed to Update Software Management Configuration

Action: Contact Technical support and provide the schema version.
Cause: The Microsoft Patch Database schema version is incompatible with this version of SA.
ErrorDetails: The Microsoft Patch Database schema version is incompatible with this version of SA

Action: When uploading a new version of the same file, remove the old version first, then upload the new version.
Cause: The request was denied because the operation is not allowed.
ErrorDetails: The request was denied because the operation is not allowed.

ErrorParams.object: Object on which requested operation is to be performed

Action: Contact Technical support and provide a copy of your Microsoft Patch Database.
Cause: An error was encountered when parsing the Microsoft Patch Database.
ErrorDetails: The Microsoft Patch Database contains unrecognized XML syntax which resulted in a failure to parse the file.

Action: Force a hardware registration on the agent initiating the connection and ensure it updates its CN in the Data Access Engine (spin).
Cause: Could not uniquely locate a device for a given cert_subject_cn and peer_ip.
ErrorDetails: Found zero devices OR more than one devices with a given cert_subject_cn OR one device for a specific CN for which none of its IP addresses match with peer_ip.

ErrorParams.peer_ip: IP of the client making the connection

Action: If you need to allow the wordcache to obtain files as needed, stage the required file(s) manually or change the caching policy for the realm to "Just-In-Time".
Cause: The file could not be cached because the caching policy for the realm prohibits it.
ErrorDetails: The Software Repository was unable to cache the file because the caching policy for its realm prohibits just-in-time download.

ErrorParams.unit_loc: The name of the file that could not be cached.

Action: Contact Technical support and provide your Microsoft Patch Database. They will recommend a source for the Microsoft Patch Database which is intended for the SA-supported version of the MBSA mbsacli.exe tool.
Cause: The Microsoft Patch Database being uploaded is for a version of the MBSA mbsacli.exe utility that is not supported by this version of SA. This was determined by examining the MBSA Tool Version value within the mssecure.xml file.
ErrorDetails: The Microsoft Patch Database being uploaded is for a version of the MBSA mbsacli.exe utility (MBSAToolVer) that is not supported by this version of SA. This was determined by examining the MBSA Tool Version value within the mssecure.xml file.

ErrorParams.mbsaToolVersion: The MBSAToolVer supported by the Microsoft Patch Database being uploaded.

Action: Upload the package directly to the SA Core's Software Repository, not to the cache.
Cause: Uploads to the SA Software Repository Caches are prohibited
ErrorDetails: An attempt was made to upload a package to an SA Software Repository Cache.
UserVisibleMessage: Upload To Software Repository Cache is Prohibited

Action: Modify the Check XML descriptor file so that it adheres to the syntax mandated by the DTD so that errors do not occur during validation.
Cause: One or more errors were encountered when validating the Check XML descriptor file against the DTD.
ErrorDetails: One or more errors were encountered when validating the Check XML descriptor file against the DTD.
UserVisibleMessage: Check XML Descriptor File against DTD Validation Error

Action: Validate the XML in config.xml for errors, correct any errors and try again
Cause: An error was encountered when parsing the config.xml file in the Audit file
ErrorDetails: An XML encoding error was encountered when parsing the config.xml file in the Audit file

ErrorParams.auditFileName: The Audit file containing the config.xml with the malformed XML

UserVisibleMessage: Config.xml File: Check XML Parse Error

Action: Validate and correct the XML in the configuration file and reupload
Cause: The config.xml in the audit file being uploaded contains XML that does not conform to the DTD
ErrorDetails: The audit file containing an XML configuration file (config.xml) that is being uploaded contains XML that does not conform to the DTD.

ErrorParams.auditFileName: The name of the file containing the Audit whose configuration is at variance from the DTD
ErrorParams.errors: These are the XML syntax elements which are not DTD conformant

UserVisibleMessage: Audit File Upload Error: Embedded config.xml XML Not DTD Conformant

Action: Replace the GUID in the check's config.xml with a value that conforms to the expected format
Cause: The check file's config.xml contains an invalid GUID.
ErrorDetails: The check file's config.xml contains an invalid GUID, it does not conform to the expected format: where X is any hexadecimal digit: XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX

ErrorParams.checkGUID: The GUID value found inside the check's config.xml

UserVisibleMessage: Check File Error: Embedded config.xml File Contains Invalid GUID

Action: Contact technical support and provide the SA component's log file.
Cause: Unable to retrieve the package information from the Model Repository (truth).
ErrorDetails: Unable to retrieve package information for the specified folder and package ID or name from the Model Repository (truth).

ErrorParams.file_name: The file name provided by the user to locate the package
ErrorParams.folder_id: The folder ID specified by the user to locate the package
ErrorParams.unit_id: The unit ID provided by the user to locate the package

UserVisibleMessage: Package ID or Name Not in Model Repository (truth)

Action: Try specifying the unit to replace by its unit ID.
Cause: Unable to determine the target for a re-upload operation. Multiple units match.
ErrorDetails: The Software Repository component, wordbot, was unable to determine which unit to replace because multiple units match the metadata of the uploaded unit.

ErrorParams.matching_unit_ids: IDs of the units that match the metadata of the uploaded unit.

Action: Try specifying the unit by its unit ID.
Cause: Unable to retrieve the package information from the Model Repository (truth).
ErrorDetails: Unable to retrieve package information for the specified file path from the Model Repository (truth).

ErrorParams.file: The file path provided by the user to locate the package

UserVisibleMessage: Package unit not found in Model Repository (truth)

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: This is a placeholder ErrorSpec. Programs should not refer to this spec when raising error.
ErrorDetails: This error spec is used to capture and model the generic parameters that are included in all errors (such as timestamp, hostname, etc)

ErrorParams.hostname: The hostname of the machine where the error was detected, as reported by uname (or the platform equivalent)
ErrorParams.line: The line in the source file (as identified by module) at which the error was originally raised.
ErrorParams.method: The name of the method or function in which the error was originally raised.
ErrorParams.module: The module (source file) in which the error was originally raised.
ErrorParams.timestamp: When the error was initially detected.  This value is likely to be close (by not identical) to the timestamp marking the error in the component's log file.

Action: Verify that the device and the Data Access Engine are functioning by running the SA Administration System Diagnosis tools. Verify that network connectivity exists between the device and the Data Access Engine.
Cause: A connection cannot be made to the Data Access Engine.
ErrorDetails: The specified device cannot connect to the Data Access Engine.

ErrorParams.hostName: The name of the host running a spin instance.

UserVisibleMessage: Connection to Data Access Engine Failed

Action: Contact technical support and provide the SA component's log file.
Cause: An unknown error occurred.
ErrorDetails: An unknown error occurred.

ErrorParams.message: The message returned by the application.

Action: Try again after ten minutes. If the error persists then please contact your local support personnel.
Cause: Couldn't connect to a Web Services Data Access Engine (twist) instance perhaps because it is still starting up.
ErrorDetails: Couldn't connect to a Web Services Data Access Engine (twist) instance perhaps because it is still starting up.
UserVisibleMessage: Failed to Connect to the Web Services Data Access Engine (twist)

Action: Verify that the device and the Command Engine are functioning by running the SA Administration System Diagnosis tools. Verify that network connectivity exists between the device and the Data Access Engine
Cause: A connection cannot be made to the Command Engine.
ErrorDetails: The specified device cannot connect to the Command Engine.

Action: Ensure that the Web Services Data Access Engine API is being invoked correctly.  Ensure the Web Services Data Access Engine as well as the Data Access Engine are functioning normally. Ensure that network communication is established
Cause: An attempt to invoke a Web Services Data Access Engine API failed.
ErrorDetails: An attempt to invoke a Web Services Data Access Engine API failed.  Either the API was invoked incorrectly (i.e. does not exist, insufficient parameters provided, etc.) or there was a network communications problem.

ErrorParams.error_desc: Description of the error that occurred.

UserVisibleMessage: Invoking the Web Services Data Access Engine API Failed

Action: Delete all networks from the network compartment before attempting to delete the network group.
Cause: This error occurs when a VLAN compartment cannot be deleted because there is a VLAN that still belongs to the compartment (a network group is called a VLAN compartment and a network is called VLAN in Data Access Engine (spin) terminology).
ErrorDetails: This error occurs when a VLAN compartment cannot be deleted because there is a VLAN that still belongs to the compartment (a network group is called a VLAN compartment and a network is called VLAN in Data Access Engine (spin) terminology).

ErrorParams.name: the name of the network group

Action: Specify a valid OCLI argument. For information about OCLI syntax or arguments, invoke the OCLI with the -h or -H argument or see the SA OCLI documentation.
Cause: The specified OCLI command line argument is invalid.
ErrorDetails: The specified OCLI command line argument is invalid.

ErrorParams.position: The position of the command line argument specified.

Action: Specify the required OCLI command line argument. For information about OCLI syntax or arguments, invoke the OCLI with the -h or -H argument or see the SA OCLI documentation.
Cause: A required OCLI command line argument was not specified.
ErrorDetails: A required OCLI command line argument was not specified.

ErrorParams.position: The position of the command line argument specified.

Action: Enter fewer OCLI command line arguments. For information about OCLI syntax or arguments, invoke the OCLI with the -h or -H argument or see the SA OCLI documentation.
Cause: Too many OCLI command line arguments specified.
ErrorDetails: Too many OCLI command line arguments specified.
UserVisibleMessage: Too Many OCLI Command Line Arguments

Action: Verify the permissions for the directory and its included files or enter a filename that can be accessed by the current user.
Cause: The specified file cannot be read.
ErrorDetails: The specified file cannot be read.

ErrorParams.localFilePath: The path of the file specified.

Action: Enter a filename that is not a directory.
Cause: The specified file is a directory and directories cannot be uploaded. Only files can be uploaded.
ErrorDetails: The specified file is a directory and directories cannot be uploaded. Only files can be uploaded.

ErrorParams.localFilePath: The path of the file specified.

Action: Enter a filename that is not a symbolic link.
Cause: The specified file is a symbolic link and symbolic links cannot be uploaded. Only files can be uploaded.
ErrorDetails: The specified file is a symbolic link and symbolic links cannot be uploaded. Only files can be uploaded.

ErrorParams.localFilePath: The path of the file specified.

Action: Enter a valid file type to upload. See the Managing Packages chapter in the SA Software Management documentation for information about supported file types.

ErrorDetails: The specified file is an unknown file type and cannot be uploaded. Only supported file types can be uploaded.

Cause: The specified customer is not unique and matches multiple customers.

Cause: The file format specified is not supported for the package type specified.
ErrorDetails: The file format specified is not supported for the package type specified.

Action: Contact technical support. See also the SA OCLI documentation for information about supported SA features.
Cause: The functionality has not been implemented.
ErrorDetails: The functionality has not been implemented.

Action: Enter a valid OCLI command line option. For information about the syntax or arguments, invoke the OCLI with the -h or -H argument or see the SA OCLI documentation.

ErrorDetails: The specified OCLI argument is invalid.

Cause: The specified OCLI command line option requires an argument.

Cause: The certificate presented does not match the certificate on record for this server
ErrorDetails: The details of the certificate presented do not match the details of the certificate on record in the Model Repository for this managed server.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: Data is not in an expected state.

{0}

Build Manager could not begin provisioning:
{0}

ErrorDetails:
Build scripts failed:
{0}

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.

ErrorDetails: The Command Engine Script was able to contact the server and issue the command to execute the script. However, an unexpected error occurred before the script could be executed on the server.

Action: Ensure that the username and password you specified are correct.
Cause: SA was unable to authenticate the user on the server.
ErrorDetails: When running a script on a server, SA uses the specified username and password credentials to authenticate the user. This authentication has failed.

ErrorDetails: The agent attempted to run the VBScript Engine but could not find it. In order to run VBScript scripts on a Windows server, the VBScript Engine must be installed.

Action: Increase the timeout value for the command to verify that it should be increased and/or examine the script itself to determine why it may have taken more than the allotted time.

ErrorDetails: When running a script on a server, the user specifies a timeout value after which the script will be killed on the server. This timeout limit was reached and the SA Agent killed the script.

Action: Verify that the script exists and is specified correctly and that the script has valid content.

ErrorDetails: When running a Distributed Script, a server is identified by a unique ID. The Command Engine found that this ID either did not exist in the Model Repository or the server had not registered with the Command Engine and had no valid ID.

ErrorParams.return_code: The return code from the script.

Action: Contact technical support.

Action: If possible, try the operation on an object that does not already exist. Otherwise contact technical support.

Action: Retry the operation with the correct username and password.
