Action: Contact technical support
Cause: An internal error occurred
ErrorDetails: An internal error occurred

Action: Obtain a new token by reauthenticating and retry the operation.
Cause: The specified token cannot be used for authentication because it is invalid.
ErrorDetails: The specified token cannot be used for authentication because it is invalid.

ErrorParams.reason: Reason the presented token is invalid

Action: Specify an account and retry the request.
Cause: A permissions check for an account-based privilege was requested but no account was supplied.
ErrorDetails: A permissions check for an account-based privilege was requested but no account was supplied.

Action: Grant the required permissions or retry the operation on a different object.
Cause: The client or user does not have the required permissions.
ErrorDetails: The client or user does not have the required permissions.

ErrorParams.object_list: Names or IDs of requested objects

Action: Verify the modification and retry the operation
Cause: An error occurred modifying a Security Role
ErrorDetails: An error occurred modifying a Security Role

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: An error occurred while retrieving data from the database.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred while retrieving data from the database. Either the database connection has failed or the data returned is not what was expected.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The channel you requested could not be found.
ErrorDetails: The channel you requested could not be found.  Either you do not have sufficient privileges or the channel was not installed

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: You do not have sufficient privileges to access the requested Channel.
ErrorDetails: You do not have sufficient privileges to access the requested Channel.

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: You do not have sufficient privileges to access the requested Account.
ErrorDetails: You do not have sufficient privileges to access the requested Account.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: There was a database connection error while trying to process your request.
ErrorDetails: There was a database connection error while trying to process your request.

Action: Contact technical support if this was a valid URL.
Cause: The URL requested was incorrect.
ErrorDetails: The URL requested was incorrect. Typically, this occurs when the URL is edited manually.

Action: Contact technical support and provide the SA component's log file.
Cause: Failed to parse an XML response from the Software Repository (word) due to error.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred while processing a response from the Software Repository (word).

Action: Contact technical support and provide the SA component's log file.
Cause: Failed to complete a remote request due to an unexpected communication error or error returned from the Software Repository (word).
ErrorDetails: Failed to complete a remote request due to an unexpected communication error or error returned from the Software Repository (word).

Action: Resolve the transaction conflict(s) by running the SA Administration Multimaster Tools. If the problem persists, contact technical support.
Cause: The local database was not successfully updated with the changes from the other database (data mismatch).
ErrorDetails: The local database was not successfully updated with the changes from the other database. Each update must affect only one row and not result in any database errors.

ErrorParams.cur_transaction: The id of the transaction record (stored at the originating database) that triggered this error.
ErrorParams.dbname: TNS name of the database that the vault attempted to update.
ErrorParams.errorMsg: The error message returned by the database (or "conflicting data" if this was not a database error.)
ErrorParams.traceback: Stack trace of the database error, if any.

Action: Restart the Vault component (a component required to run SA in Multimaster mode).
Cause: A Multimaster database error occurred.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred while querying the database for updates to send to other databases or while applying updates from other databases.

ErrorParams.dbname: The TNS name of the database that this vault instance is talking to.
ErrorParams.errorMsg: Error Message returned by the database.
ErrorParams.traceback: Stack trace of the error returned by the database.
ErrorParams.tran_id: ID of the transaction record that triggered this error, if any.

Action: Resolve the error condition. Restart the vault component (a component required to run SA in Multimaster mode).
Cause: An error occurred when the vault process started.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred when the vault process started. The application returned the displayed message. The thread that encountered the error stopped running. This error occurs when running SA in Multimaster mode.

ErrorParams.dbname: TNS name of the database the vault is talking to.
ErrorParams.traceback: Stack trace of the thread at the point the error was encountered.

Action: Run the SA Administration Multimaster Tools to verify that transaction data does not contain special characters that the XML parser might be unable to interpret.
Cause: An error occurred when parsing the XML representation of the transaction.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred when parsing the XML representation of the transaction. The application returned the displayed message. This error occurs when running SA in Multimaster mode.

ErrorParams.MessageBody: XML that could not be parsed.
ErrorParams.dbname: TNS name of the database that the vault is talking to.
ErrorParams.errorMsg: Error Message returned by the parser.

Action: Run the SA Administration Multimaster Tools and verify that transaction data does not contain special characters that SOAP might be unable to interpret.
Cause: A SOAP protocol error occurred.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred while using SOAP libraries to marshall/unmarshall transactions into XML. The application returned the message specified. This error occurs when running SA in Multimaster mode.

ErrorParams.dbname: TNS name of the database the vault is talking to.
ErrorParams.errorMsg: Error Message returned by the SOAP library

Action: Resolve the TIBCO transport error. See the TIBCO User's Guide for information. Restart the vault (a component required to run SA in Multimaster mode).
Cause: The TIBCO transport raised an error.
ErrorDetails: The TIBCO transport raised an error. The application returned the displayed message. The thread that encountered the error stopped running. This error occurs when running SA in Multimaster mode.

ErrorParams.dbname: TNS name of the database that this vault instance is talking to.
ErrorParams.traceback: Stack trace corresponding to the error.

Action: Contact technical support and provide the database name and SA component's log file.
Cause: The vault process encountered an error.
ErrorDetails: The vault process encountered an error. The application returned the displayed message. This error occurs when running SA in Multimaster mode.

ErrorParams.dbname: TNS name of the database that the vault is talking to

Action: Log in to the SA Command Center and specify a value for this configuration parameter.
Cause: Missing configuration value.
ErrorDetails: No value has been specified for the configuration parameter.

ErrorParams.dbname: tnsname of the database to which this vault instance is connected

Action: Verify that the Gateway configuration for the client is valid and points to a running SA Gateway service.
Cause: The client was able to connect to a Gateway, but the Gateway service did not return a valid HTTP response.
ErrorDetails: In order to establish a connection with a server in a different realm from the client, the connection must be proxied by a local Gateway.  The client was able to contact a Gateway but the service did not return a valid HTTP response.
UserVisibleMessage: Received Non-HTTP Reply from Gateway Service

Action: Verify that the Gateway configuration for the client is valid, and points to a running SA Gateway service.
Cause: The client encountered a protocol error while communicating with the SA Gateway
ErrorDetails: In order to establish a connection with a server in a different realm from the client, the connection must be proxied by a local Gateway.  The client was able to contact a Gateway but encountered a protocol error while communicating.

ErrorParams.num_bytes: The number of unconsumed bytes in the stream.

Action: Contact technical support and provide the reply code.
Cause: The SA Gateway returned an error reply.
ErrorDetails: In order to establish a connection with a server in a different realm from the client, the connection must be proxied by a local Gateway.  The client was able to contact a Gateway but the Gateway service returned an error reply code.

ErrorParams.reply_code: The error reply code returned by the gateway

Action: Verify that the Gateway configuration for the client is valid and points to a running SA Gateway service. Ensure also that the Gateway network is properly configured to provide at least one path between the local and remote realms.
Cause: Unable to establish a tunnel to the remote realm.
ErrorDetails: In order to establish a connection with a server in a different realm from the client, the connection must be proxied by a local Gateway.  The client was unable to establish a tunneled connection to the remote realm through any of the Gateways configured for the client.

ErrorParams.gw_list: The list of gateways that the client is configured to use.

Action: Ensure that Gateways are defined for the client and/or that the Gateway configuration is valid and points to at least one running SA Gateway service.
Cause: Attempted to initiate a connection to a server in a different realm with no Gateways defined.
ErrorDetails: In order to establish a connection with a server in a different realm from the client, the connection must be proxied by a local Gateway.  This was not possible because the client does not have any Gateways defined.

Action: Verify the ident server is running.  Verify that this server is attempting to contact the correct ident server host and port.
Cause: The server was unable to contact the Gateway ident server.
ErrorDetails: In order to discover the actual peer IP of a request, a server must contact a Gateway ident server to resolve the IP and realm.  This server was either unable to contact the ident server or received an error retrieving the data.

ErrorParams.gateway: The address of the gateway ident server.
ErrorParams.message: The error message received by the server when contacting the ident server.

Action: Specify a valid mode for the check_reachability script.
Cause: The check_reachability script mode specified is not valid.
ErrorDetails: The check_reachability script mode specified is not valid.  It must be one of OVERSEER or EXECUTOR.

Action: Omit the non-local device or run the check_reachability script in OVERSEER mode.
Cause: The check_reachability script is running in EXECUTOR mode but a non-local device is specified.
ErrorDetails: When run in EXECUTOR mode, the check_reachability script can only operate on local devices (devices managed by the core facility where the script is run). The specified device is managed by a remote facility.

ErrorParams.dvc_dc: The ID of the Facility that manages the device.
ErrorParams.local_dc: The ID of the local facility (where the script is running)

UserVisibleMessage: Non-Local Device Not Supported in EXECUTOR Mode

Action: See error details for appropriate action.
Cause: A job error has occurred.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred while executing an asynchronous Web Services Data Access Engine (twist) operation.

Action: Check the error output of the script to see why the script returned a non-zero exit code. Also check the contents of the script to help with debugging the problem.
Cause: A script returned a non-zero exit code
ErrorDetails: A script executed in the OGFS returned a non-zero exit code. Non-zero exit codes indicate errors.

ErrorParams.return_code: The return code from the script.

Action: Read the error message and respond accordingly.
Cause: SA failed to read the source of the OGFS script.
ErrorDetails: SA must be able to read the source of an OGFS script in order to execute it. The Web Services Data Access Engine (twist) was unable to read the source of the script.

Action: Read the error message and respond accordingly.
Cause: SA failed to write the source of an OGFS script to a temporary file.
ErrorDetails: When executing an OGFS script, SA stores the script text in a temporary file and then executes the script from that file. SA was unable to write the script to a temporary file.
UserVisibleMessage: Write OGFS Script Source to Temporary File Failed

Action: Increase the timeout value for the command to verify that it should be increased and/or examine the script itself to determine why it may have taken more than the allotted time.
Cause: The script took longer to run in the OGFS than the timeout specified by the user.
ErrorDetails: When running a script on in the OGFS, the user specifies a timeout after which the script will be killed on the server. This timeout limit was reached and SA killed the executing script.

Action: Contact your SA Administrator to check for an incorrectly configured SA Core.
Cause: An unexpected error occurred while executing the script.
ErrorDetails: The Command Engine script was able to contact the Data Access Engine and issue the command to execute the script, however, an unexpected error occurred before the script could be executed in the OGFS.

Action: Enter a valid package type. See the SA Software Management documentation for information about supported package types.
Cause: The specified package type is unknown.
ErrorDetails: The specified package type is unknown.

Action: Enter a unique package type by specifying the full package type or enter enough of the type to uniquely identify it. See the SA Software Management documentation for information about supported package types.
Cause: The specified package type is not unique and matches multiple package types.
ErrorDetails: The package type specified is not unique and matches multiple package types.

ErrorParams.matches: All package types that match the one specified.

Action: Verify that the package exists in SA using the SA Command Center or enter a package that exists on the Package Repository.
Cause: The specified file cannot be found in the Package Repository.
ErrorDetails: The file specified cannot be found in the Package Repository.

ErrorParams.customer: The customer of the file specified.
ErrorParams.fileName: The name of the file specified.
ErrorParams.os: The operating system of the file specified.

Action: Enter a unique remote filename by specifying the full file ID or name or enter enough of the ID or name to uniquely identify the remote file.
Cause: The specified remote file is not unique in the Package Repository and matches multiple remote files.
ErrorDetails: The specified remote file is not unique and matches multiple remote files.

ErrorParams.customer: The customer of the file specified.
ErrorParams.fileName: The name of the file specified.
ErrorParams.matches: All remote files that match the one specified.
ErrorParams.os: The operating system of the file specified.

Action: If the cancellation was unintentional, retry the operation.
Cause: The download of the remote file specified was cancelled.
ErrorDetails: The download of the remote file specified was cancelled.

ErrorParams.localFilePath: The local path of the file.
ErrorParams.os: The operating system of the file.
ErrorParams.remoteFileName: The file name of the remote file.

Action: If the cancellation was unintentional, retry the operation.
Cause: The upload of the remote file specified was cancelled.
ErrorDetails: The upload of the remote file specified was cancelled.

ErrorParams.localFilePath: The local path of the file.
ErrorParams.os: The operating system of the file.
ErrorParams.remoteFileName: The file name of the remote file.

Action: Enter a valid file format. See the SA Software Management documentation for information about supported file formats.
Cause: The file format specified is not a known file format.
ErrorDetails: The file format specified is not a known file format.

Action: Enter a unique file format by specifying the full file format or enter enough to uniquely identify the file format. See the SA Software Management documentation for information about supported file formats.
Cause: The file format specified is not unique and matches multiple file formats.
ErrorDetails: The file format specified is not unique and matches multiple file formats.

ErrorParams.matches: All file formats that match the one specified.

Action: Try increasing the timeout period with the --timeout option.
Cause: The timeout period for communicating with a remote host expired.
ErrorDetails: The default timeout period of 60 seconds expired prior to successfully communicating with the remote host.

ErrorParams.remoteHost: The remote host with which a timeout occurred.
ErrorParams.remotePort: The port on the remote host with which a timeout occurred.

Action: Enter a supported package type for the specified operating system. See the SA Software Management documentation for information about the supported package types and operating systems.
Cause: The operating system specified does not support the package type specified.
ErrorDetails: The operating system specified does not support the package type specified.
UserVisibleMessage: OCLI: Incompatible Operating System for Package Type

Action: Try increasing the timeout period with the --timeout option during file upload.  Post-processing of the file may continue on the remote host and the file may be available later despite this error.
Cause: The timeout period for communicating with a remote host expired during file upload.
ErrorDetails: The default timeout period of 60 seconds expired prior to successfully communicating with the remote host during file upload.

ErrorParams.remoteHost: The remote host with which a timeout occurred.
ErrorParams.remotePort: The port on the remote host with which a timeout occurred.

Action: Enter a different customer by specifying the full customer ID or name, or enter enough of the ID or name to uniquely identify the customer.
Cause: The specified customer is not allowed to own packages or packages of a certain type.
ErrorDetails: The customer specified is not allowed to own packages or packages of a certain type.
UserVisibleMessage: OCLI: Customer Not Allowed To Own Package

Action: Enter a local file by specifying the full path or enter enough of the path using wildcards to uniquely identify the file.
Cause: The specified local file name is not unique and matches multiple files.
ErrorDetails: The specified local file name is not unique and matches multiple files.

ErrorParams.localFilePaths: The paths of the files specified.

UserVisibleMessage: OCLI: Specified Local File Name Not Unique

Action: Please use a valid ISM Archive Path.
Cause: The ISM Archive Path is invalid.
ErrorDetails: The ISM Archive Path is invalid.

Action: Please use a valid ISM Configuration
Cause: The ISM Configuration is invalid.
ErrorDetails: The ISM Configuration is invalid.

Action: Please enter a valid ISM directory.
Cause: The directory is invalid.
ErrorDetails: The directory is invalid.

Action: Please enter valid parameters.
Cause: The specified parameters are invalid.
ErrorDetails: The specified parameters are invalid.

Action: Please use a valid XML Descriptor.
Cause: The XML Descriptor is invalid.
ErrorDetails: The XML Descriptor is invalid.

Action: Please enter valid credentials.
Cause: The specified credentials are invalid.
ErrorDetails: The specified credentials are invalid.

Action: Please enter a valid folder path.
Cause: The specified folder was not found.
ErrorDetails: The specified folder was not found.

Action: Please contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: The OCC server experienced an error.
ErrorDetails: The OCC server experienced an internal server error.

Action: Please use a valid ISM Archive Path.
Cause: The ISM Archive Path could not be found.
ErrorDetails: The ISM Archive Path could not be found.

Action: Please use a valid ISM Archive Directory.
Cause: The ISM archive directory could not be found.
ErrorDetails: The ISM archive directory could not be found.
UserVisibleMessage: OCLI: ISM Archive Directory Not Found

Action: Please use a valid Codeset.
Cause: The Codeset is invalid.
ErrorDetails: The Codeset is invalid.

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: An error occurred in the Configuration Tracking system while executing an external program.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred in the Configuration Tracking system while executing an external program. The Configuration Tracking system executes various external programs during processing and one of these programs failed or produced unexpected results.

ErrorParams.cmd: The text of the command-line being executed.
ErrorParams.error_code: The exit code of the command.

Action: This error occurs when the local Configuration Tracking policy file becomes corrupted. To repair it, perform a Configuration Tracking policy reconcile on this device. If this error persists, contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: The Configuration Tracking system was unable to process the Configuration Tracking policy.
ErrorDetails: The Configuration Tracking system was unable to process the Configuration Tracking policy stored in the indicated file. It was unable to determine which files and objects should be monitored and backed up.

ErrorParams.db_filename: The name of the file which should contain the backup policy.

Action: This error may occur if the Agent does not have sufficient privileges to write to the Configuration Tracking policy file or if the directory specified as containing the Configuration Tracking policy file does not exist.  Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: The Configuration Tracking system was unable to save the Configuration Tracking policy to a local file.
ErrorDetails: The Configuration Tracking system was unable to save the Configuration Tracking policy to a local file.

ErrorParams.msg: The message returned by the application.

UserVisibleMessage: Error Writing Configuration Tracking Policy File

Action: There may be a problem with the Package Repository.  Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: The restore operation failed because an archive file is corrupted.
ErrorDetails: The restore operation failed because an archive file is corrupted. During a restore operation, the agent downloads the archive file to be restored from the Package Repository. An error occurs when the file received from the Package Repository is not a valid archive.

ErrorParams.archive_file: The archive file which is corrupt.

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: The Configuration Tracking system was unable to locate a required binary executable.
ErrorDetails: The Configuration Tracking system was unable to locate a required binary executable. This is most likely caused by a misconfigured or corrupt Agent installation.
UserVisibleMessage: Configuration Tracking Utility Program Not Found

Action: Remove the conflicting object(s) from the local file system.
Cause: The Configuration Tracking system was unable to restore one or more targets because there are existing, but incompatible, object(s) of the same name(s) in the local file system.
ErrorDetails: The Configuration Tracking system was unable to restore a target because there are existing, but incompatible, object(s) of the same name(s) in the local file system.  For example, if the target to be restored is a file, but there is a directory on the local file system with the same name, the operation will fail.

ErrorParams.targets: The targets which failed to restore.

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: An error occurred in the Configuration Tracking system while attempting to write to a file.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred in the Configuration Tracking system while attempting to write to a file. This may happen if the file doesn't exist or the agent does not have sufficient privileges to write to and/or create the file.

Action: Modify your policy to ensure that fewer targets are scanned. See the SA Configuration Tracking documentation for more information.
Cause: The Configuration Tracking policy specifies too many targets to be scanned.
ErrorDetails: The Configuration Tracking policy specifies too many targets to be scanned. Possible causes are: one or more entries using wildcards that match too many files, directories that contain too many files, or, simply too many entries. The Configuration Tracking policy global limit per device may have been exceeded.

ErrorParams.directive: The directive that was being processed when the scan limit was exceeded.

UserVisibleMessage: Too Many Targets To Be Scanned

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: An internal error occurred while processing the Configuration Tracking policy.
ErrorDetails: An internal error occurred while processing the Configuration Tracking policy. The specified Configuration Tracking policy object is invalid.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: An internal error occurred while processing the Configuration Tracking policy.
ErrorDetails: An internal error occurred while processing the Configuration Tracking policy. The supplied Configuration Tracking policy object contains an invalid entry.

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: An error occurred in the Configuration Tracking system while attempting to restore a target.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred in the Configuration Tracking system while attempting to restore a target. Possible causes include insufficient or incorrect Agent privileges, a corrupt archive, or invalid data.

ErrorParams.error_text: The error message returned by the application.

Action: Retry the operation later.  If the problem persists, contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: A Configuration Tracking operation was attempted while another Configuration Tracking operation was already in progress.
ErrorDetails: A Configuration Tracking operation was attempted while another Configuration Tracking operation was already in progress. Only one Configuration Tracking operation can be running on a device at a time.  This error can occur because another user is performing a Configuration Tracking operation on the device or the Configuration Tracking system was performing a scheduled operation.
UserVisibleMessage: Another Configuration Tracking Operation Already In Progress

Action: Modify your Configuration Tracking policy to reduce the number of targets to be scanned.
Cause: A single Configuration Tracking policy entry causes too many targets to be scanned.
ErrorDetails: A single Configuration Tracking policy entry causes too many targets to be scanned. This can happen when a wildcard matches too many files or when a specified directory contains too many files.

ErrorParams.directive: The directive which is causing too many targets to be scanned.

UserVisibleMessage: Too Many Targets To Be Scanned

Action: Edit the Configuration Tracking policy so the oversized target is not scanned.
Cause: A target is too large to be backed up.
ErrorDetails: A target is too large to be backed up.  This error aborts the scanning process.

ErrorParams.directive: The directive which caused the offending target to be scanned.

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: An unexpected error occurred while backing up data to the server.
ErrorDetails: The Command Engine script received an unexpected error from the server while backing up data to the server.

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: An unexpected error occurred while restoring data to the server.
ErrorDetails: The Command Engine script received an unexpected error from the server while restoring data to the server.

Action: Contact your SA Administrator and provide the error message below.
Cause: An error occurred in the Configuration Tracking system.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred in the Configuration Tracking system.

ErrorParams.msg: The information returned by the application.

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: An unexpected error occurred while retrieving the Configuration Tracking policy stored on the server.
ErrorDetails: In order to compare what is stored on a server and what is stored in the Model Repository (truth), the Command Engine must contact the server and request its current Configuration Tracking policy. The Command Engine was able to contact the server but was unable to retrieve the policy.
UserVisibleMessage: Failed To Retrieve Configuration Tracking Policy

Action: Attempt to determine why the listed files failed to restore. If possible, fix any errors and retry the restore.
Cause: The restore operation did not fully complete.
ErrorDetails: An error occurred while restoring file(s)/target(s) to the server. All targets not listed were successfully restored.

ErrorParams.failed_tgts: The list of targets that failed to restore and the reason that they failed.

Action: The SA Agent is installed on the server but cannot communicate with the Data Access Engine. Try restarting the SA Agent on the server and retry the operation.
Cause: An invalid server ID was passed to a Command Engine script.
ErrorDetails: In order for the Command Engine to communicate with a server, the SA Agent on the server must register itself with the Command Engine. This error can occur when the Agent registration is unsuccessful.

ErrorParams.dvc_id: The ID of the Server that wasn't registered in the Truth

Action: Please contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: Invalid or incorrect parameters were passed to a Configuration Tracking system Command Engine script.
ErrorDetails: A Command Engine script for the Configuration Tracking system receive arguments in an invalid format or did not receive required arguments.

ErrorParams.missing_parameters: The parameters that were required to be present and where not

UserVisibleMessage: Incorrect or Missing Parameters for Command Engine Script

Action: Contact your SA representative. This is typically caused by SA misconfiguration.
Cause: The Command Engine script does not have sufficient privileges to communicate with this device.
ErrorDetails: The Command Engine scripts must be granted explicit permissions to communicate with devices associated with a customer. The invoked Command Engine script does not have the required permissions.
UserVisibleMessage: Script Has Insufficient Privileges for Device

Action: Another SA user is currently using the device. Retry the operation later. If the problem persists, contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: The Command Engine script cannot lock the device for use by the Configuration Tracking system.
ErrorDetails: The Command Engine script locks each device before communicating with it. The script was unable to lock this device.

Action: The SA Agent on the server may not be functioning. There may also be communication problems between the Command Engine and the SA Agent. Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: The Command Engine cannot communicate with a server.
ErrorDetails: The Command Engine attempted to contact a server and was either unable to connect to the server or the server was unable to respond to the communication.

Action: There is a possible networking issue between the two facilities or SA may be misconfigured. Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: The Command Engine cannot proxy its command from one facility to another.
ErrorDetails: When communicating with a server in another facility, the Command Engine will proxy commands from the source facility to the server's facility. The commands proxy failed.

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: An unexpected error occurred while updating the Configuration Tracking policy stored on the server.
ErrorDetails: In order to install the Configuration Tracking policy on the server the Command Engine must communicate with the server. The Command Engine was able to contact the server but was unable to update the policy.
UserVisibleMessage: Failed To Set Configuration Tracking Policy

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: An unexpected error occurred while verifying the Configuration Tracking policy to be installed on the server.
ErrorDetails: In order to verify the Configuration Tracking policy to be installed on the server, the Command Engine must communicate with the server. The Command Engine was able to contact the server but was unable to perform the verification of the Configuration Tracking policy.
UserVisibleMessage: Failed To Verify Configuration Tracking Policy

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: An invalid Configuration Tracking system backup is stored in the Package Repository.
ErrorDetails: The Package Repository is where all Configuration Tracking system backup archives are stored. The backup archive being accessed was found to be invalid.

ErrorParams.backup_id: The ID of the invalid backup archive

UserVisibleMessage: Invalid Configuration Tracking System Backup in the Package Repository

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: An unexpected error occurred while updating the Configuration Tracking agent state.
ErrorDetails: In order to change the Configuration Tracking agent state, the Command Engine must communicate with the server. The Command Engine was able to contact the server but was unable to update the configuration tracking agent state.
UserVisibleMessage: Failed to Set Configuration Tracking Agent State

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: The Package Repository was unable to send a file for downloading to the client.
ErrorDetails: The Package Repository is where all Configuration Tracking system backup archives are stored. While a client was attempting to download an archive, the Package Repository was unable to send that archive to the client.

ErrorParams.error_desc: A Description of the error that occurred

UserVisibleMessage: Package Repository Unable to Send Package to Client

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: Invalid arguments passed to the Package Repository.
ErrorDetails: The Package Repository is where all Configuration Tracking system backup archives are stored. While communicating with the Package Repository, invalid arguments were specified and the Package Repository was unable to complete the request.
UserVisibleMessage: Invalid Arguments Passed to Package Repository

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: An invalid request was made to the Package Repository.
ErrorDetails: The Package Repository is where all Configuration Tracking system backup archives are stored. While communicating with the Package Repository, an invalid request was issued by the client.

ErrorParams.error_desc: A description of the error that caused the request to be invalid

UserVisibleMessage: Invalid Request Made to the Package Repository

Action: Contact your SA administrator.
Cause: The directory to which an archive was to be downloaded could not be created.
ErrorDetails: When the Configuration Tracking system attempts to restore configurations to a server it must download the configurations to the server's hard disk. The directory to which the SA Agent attempted to download the configurations could not be created.

ErrorParams.dir: The directory could not be created

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: The Configuration Tracking system was unable to download the configurations archive in order to restore configurations to a server.
ErrorDetails: In order to restore configurations to a server, the Configuration Tracking system must contact the Package Repository to download previously backed up configurations but the operation failed.

ErrorParams.error_desc: Detailed description of the error that occurred.

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: The Package Repository presented invalid information in response to a download request.
ErrorDetails: In order to restore configurations to a server, the Configuration Tracking system must communicate with the Package Repository and request the configurations to download. The response from the Package Repository was invalid.

ErrorParams.error_desc: Detailed description of the error that occurred.

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: The Configuration Tracking system was unable to upload a configurations archive to the Package Repository.
ErrorDetails: In order to backup configurations on a server, the Configuration Tracking system must contact the Package Repository but the operation failed.

ErrorParams.error_desc: Detailed description of the error that occurred.

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.
Cause: The manifest data inside a Configuration Tracking system archive was invalid.
ErrorDetails: Each backup run by the Configuration Tracking system includes a manifest that itemizes the information contained within the backup. An error occurred while parsing the manifest data.

ErrorParams.lineno: The Line number in the manifest file that contained the error

Action: Ensure that the server's SA Agent is functioning. Ensure that the SA Agent can communicate with the Command Engine.
Cause: The Command Engine timed-out while executing a command on a server.
ErrorDetails: When the Command Engine executes a command on a server it sets a time limit for command execution. This time limit was exceeded.
UserVisibleMessage: Command Engine Command Execution Timed Out

Action: Contact technical Support and provide the key information shown below.
Cause: An internal error occurred while processing the Configuration Tracking policy.
ErrorDetails: An internal error occurred while processing the Configuration Tracking policy. The supplied Configuration Tracking policy object contains an invalid entry.

Action: Either specify the correct type in the Model Repository or log on to the server and fix the mismatched target type. If the Configuration Tracking policy is incorrect only for a specific server(s), you can add a server level override for the policy causing the error.
Cause: While reconciling a policy onto a server, some server targets do not match the type of the Model Repository targets.
ErrorDetails: When reconciling policy onto a server it is possible that the target type specified in the Model Repository will not match the target type on the server. For example, the model specifies /etc/foo/bar as type file, but on the server, /etc/foo/bar is type directory. Configuration Tracking skips this target when checking for changes.

ErrorParams.skipped_list: List of targets that where skipped

UserVisibleMessage: Targets Skipped Due to Type Mismatch

Action: Contact technical support
Cause: The SA Agent encountered an error while processing the Windows Registry.

Action: Contact technical support.
Cause: The script could not run due to access control restrictions.

Action: The server is no longer manageable by SA. Log on to the server and update its network configuration.
Cause: The Agent did not register with the SA Core within the specified timeout period.
ErrorDetails: A new network configuration may prevent a server from contacting the SA core. Either the Agent was unable to revert to the previous configuration or was specifically requested not to do so.

Action: Ensure that the new configuration allows communication with the SA core.
Cause: The server's network configuration is not as expected after a reboot.
ErrorDetails: The server's network configuration is not as expected after a reboot. The new configuration may prevent communication with the SA Core and the server has reverted to its previous configuration.

ErrorParams.reverts: A list of configuration parameters that are not as requested and have reverted to their previous values.
ErrorParams.unexps: A list of configuration parameters that changed without being asked to.

Job failed due to an unknown error.

Action: Verify agent process is running on managed server and run a communication test to mark it as reachable.

ErrorDetails: Managed server is marked as unreachable

Cause: The managed server is marked as reachable but can not be properly communicated with.
ErrorDetails: Unable to communicate with the managed server
Action: Verify SA Agent process is running on the managed server and run a communication test to verify it as reachable.
This may also represent networking problems between the SA Core and the managed server.
Re-install the SA agent on the managed server.
Cause: The provided server has been deactivated in this SA Core.

Action: Verify the vault is up and that transactions are being received by the remote core.
Check that the system value, way.ssct_proxy_timeout, is set to a reasonable value.

ErrorDetails: A transaction failed to arrive to a remote data center and the operation timed out

Action: Verify the core can communicate with the managed server.

Action: Reassign the servers to other customers (or to ''Not Assigned'').

Action: This may mean the SA Agent on the server is not functioning. It may also represent networking problems between the Command Engine and the SA Agent on the server. Contact your SA administrator for further assistance.
Cause: The Command Engine cannot communicate with a server.
ErrorDetails: The Command Engine attempted to contact a server but was either unable to connect to the server or the server was unable to respond.

Action: This may represent a networking issue between the two facilities or SA may be misconfigured. Contact your SA administrator for further assistance.
Cause: When communicating with servers in another facility, the Command Engine proxies commands from the source facility to the servers'' facility. The command proxy failed.
ErrorDetails: The Command Engine cannot proxy a command from one facility to another.

ErrorParams.dc_ids: The ID(s) of the facility or facilities that could not be reached (may not be present).

Action: Contact your SA Administrator.

Action: Ensure that the server''s SA Agent is functioning. Ensure that the SA Agent can communicate with the Command Engine. If neither of these are the problem, contact your SA Administrator.

ErrorDetails: An operation in the job timed out.

Action: Ensure that the arguments submitted to the Command Engine are valid.
